concept.title: Deploying and Configuring the BIRT Report Engine

section.p: uses BIRT to generate reports. BIRT is not included in the packages. To be able to generate reports, you need to obtain and manually deploy BIRT on your own.
BIRT needs to be deployed on a different application server than . The following application servers are supported:

Oracle GlassFish Server, version 3
Apache Tomcat, version 8 To be able to generate reports, proceed as follows:

ol.li: Download the latest version of Eclipse BIRT runtime, for example, from http://www.eclipse.org.
Deploy the birt.war archive to a domain on the GlassFish 3 or Tomcat application server.

Add the report designs and localized labels to the folder of the birt application on the application server.
The report designs and labels are available in the following archive provided for each release: oscm-reports.zip. Extract the contents of this archive to the root folder of the birt application:
<GLASSFISH3_HOME>/glassfish/domains/<domain>/applications/birt or
<TOMCAT_HOME>/webapps/birt.

Adjust the REPORT_ENGINEURL configuration setting in as follows:
Log in to the administration portal with the platform operator user role.
From the Operation menu, choose Update configuration settings.
Adjust the host IP address to the one of the application server to which you deployed the report engine. For example:http://<tomcat host IP address>:<port>/birt/frameset? __report=${reportname}.rptdesign&SessionId=${sessionid} &__locale=${locale}&WSDLURL=${wsdlurl}&SOAPEndPoint=${soapendpoint} &wsname=Report&wsport=ReportPort

section.p: Each time you install a new release of , you should also check for new releases of BIRT and changes in the report designs and labels and update them as required.

conbody.section:
Exchanging Certificates
For secure communication of the BIRT report engine with ,you need to exchange the corresponding certificates. is the HTTPS server while the BIRT report engine is a Web service client. The Web service calls are secured with SSL. The following requirements must be met to establish a connection to :
The server must present a valid certificate.
The certificate must be trusted by the BIRT report engine.
You need to:
Import the certificate of into the truststore of the domain to which you have deployed BIRT.
Export the certificate of the domain to which you have deployed BIRT and import it into the bes-domain application server domain of . Refer to the Operator's Guide for details on certificate handling.
